title: Magnetic flux - spinning coil in uniform B-field

content.description: A loop of wire spins in a uniform magnetic field <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math>. At time <math alttext="t equals t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, the plane of the loop is perpendicular to the magnetic field, as shown, and the magnitude of the magnetic flux through the loop is <math alttext="phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. At times <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> the loop has rotated <math alttext="one fourth" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math> and <math alttext="one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> of a complete rotation, respectively, and the magnitude of the magnetic flux through the loop is <math alttext="phi sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="phi sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="phi sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="phi sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>?
content.question: A<math alttext="phi sub 1 is greater than phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math><math alttext="phi sub 2 is less than phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>B<math alttext="phi sub 1 is greater than phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math><math alttext="phi sub 2 equals phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>C<math alttext="phi sub 1 is less than phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math><math alttext="phi sub 2 is less than phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>D<math alttext="phi sub 1 is less than phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math><math alttext="phi sub 2 equals phi sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">Φ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
